# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width=10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in split(text, r"\s+"))
        if width_of(current_line) + width_of(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " $word"
        end
    end
    
    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nullam in felis vitae est vehicula facilisis id lacus."

wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 20)
println(wrapped_text)
```
This code defines a `wrap_string` function that takes a text and a maximum line width. It splits the text into words, wraps the lines when necessary, and returns the wrapped text.

The example usage demonstrates how to use the `wrap_string` function with a specific line width.
